website_summaries.verdict: Affordably priced and built to maintain one's body temperature in cold but not extreme conditions.
pros: Reviewers note the softness of the fabric
Skin is exposed to the cotton inner layer, while the wool outer layer preserves warmth
Keeps customers continually warm time and time again
cons: The general cut may feel awkward

customer_reviews.title: Great fabric but be cautious on size
customer_reviews.text: The "size chart" needs to be corrected ASAP!! According to box the thermals arrived in, SMALL is 28-30, MEDIUM is 32-34, LARGE 36-38, XL 40-42, 2XL 44-46. Size chart on order page states Medium is waist 34-36 which is not same as box at all!! Fortunately I have son's who can wear the medium ordered for Dad but I have to reorder a large cuz medium I'd thought was 34-36 is incorrect! Beware!
customer_reviews.author: Bergsma

customer_reviews.title: Shrinks a fair amount!
customer_reviews.text: Here are measurements of the medium sized bottom, before and after washing/drying on low heat. Before: overall length 40", width across hips 18" After: overall length 37", width across hips 17.5". Waistband at rest is 31". If contemplating a medium, compare above with a garment that fits well. Feel of fabric is very soft and light, altogether quite comfortable. Seems warm enough for normal daily outdoor activities in 30 to 40 degree weather. I would encourage others to post the before/after washing dimensions of articles of clothing they review. Much more useful than statements that it shrank up to one's knees etc. etc.
customer_reviews.author: Vin Talwar

customer_reviews.title: Nice material; bizarre fit.
customer_reviews.text: I love the material, but I have no idea why they cut it in this manner. The waist is perfect, but the crotch is way too big and low, and the legs are short. I don't know what kind of creature these were designed for, but they probably have fur already and are thus not in need of thermal underwear.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for my husband.
customer_reviews.text: We have bought Duofold long johns for years, but these where weird, they started out fitting just like his other pairs, but as he wore and washed them a few times they shrunk up in the legs to the point that they are more than 6 inches shorter than they started. I'll include a picture of me wearing them, but it's worse on him.
customer_reviews.author: Little Otter

customer_reviews.title: Waistband only lasts a year.
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing Duofold thermal underwear as long as I can recall. I have some bottoms that are at least 20 years old, and are basically nothing but tatters--but the waistband elastic still works! I've bought three pairs of these over the last two years. Two pairs--bought two years ago--are now useless as the waistband elastic is totally shot. There is absolutely no stretch left and the bottoms will not stay up. Otherwise, the fabric still looks like new. For the price, I expected to get years of use out of these--not one just year (actually one season).
customer_reviews.author: TTT

customer_reviews.title: Same exact product as the cheaper one not labeled as "double layer"
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly the same product as the non-double-layer version that is almost half the price. The labels on each are different so I am pretty sure I did not receive the wrong product unless they mislabeled the item itself (not just packaging). There is no reason to purchase this one. Get the cheaper one.
customer_reviews.author: anon

customer_reviews.title: Launders easily but with wrinkles
customer_reviews.text: Compared Duofold's Double Layer Thermals and FX MAXHEAT Soft Fleece Thermals. Duofold Double Layer thermal is mainly cotton and wool. It's thicker so it feels comparatively warmer. Launders easily but with wrinkles. Fits comfortably with a looser fit. Crotch hole. FX MAXHEAT is made of a combination of fleece inside and polyester outside. It's pretty warm for how thin it feels. Launders easily like a dream with no wrinkles at all. Fits comfortably with a tight fitting stretch to show off what you got if desired. No crotch hole. When hiking I plan to use Duofold, for everyday use I use FX MAXHEAT
customer_reviews.author: Ruben Aguilar

customer_reviews.title: Feels really warm and a good fit.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my 6'1, 210 husband and it fits really well. This Original style in a large was a good fit for him. It fit around his waist (hes wears a 36 inch in regular pants) and good length on his legs. Fit right at his ankles. My husband has several style's of the Duofold thermals in shirts and pants. He really likes there products. The Original style pant feels warm and soft. Its considered "Warmest"on the Duofold chart. He hasn't had a chance to test that, but based on past performance with other Duofold thermals, it should be. Was really happy over all with the fit on him, not to tight, but form fitting.
customer_reviews.author: S. Renee

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Some reviews mention that these seem to have a really long crotch line. Well, actually they are high-waisted which simply means they initially sit above the waistline. But my experience is that they shronk down after 3-4 washings and begin to comform to your body thereafter. So I think its probably better to have long johns that sit a little higher so when you bend over on some cold and windy day you won't feel the North wind blowing down your b.c. !
customer_reviews.author: jeff b.

customer_reviews.title: I love summer
customer_reviews.text: I love summer, which is a way to say I hate winter and look for ways to defeat it. I wear these as a middle layer (underwear, then these, then pants; optional snow pants overtop), and they really keep your legs warm, which actually helps keep your feet warm, which makes sense, but I hadn't realized. The quality is good. The color is exactly as it appears on screen. They look like the ones in the picture. The legs are JUST long enough that I can put my boot socks over top, but I'm 6'4" so you'll probably have it easier.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Bulky inseam/crotch
customer_reviews.text: Im 6ft - 31-32 waist and 155 LBS I ordered a Medium The ankles are just 2-3" too short, just enough to live with but be annoying, hoping the stretch out alittle with use and that will go away. The main reason im giving these 3 star is because the crotch/inseam is really bulk/long..i like my thermals to be more form fitting, like a boxer brief with legs and warmth essentially. These are not, its rather awkward and uncomfortable, where the crotch is sewn to the legs is a good 4-5" to long..very bulk and stiff. If this were to be fixed these would be 6* thermals, the material is amazing, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse R

customer_reviews.title: Five stars from me!
customer_reviews.text: Buying clothes online is a little tricky since you don’t know when you buy them for the first time how the fit is going to be, so when buying something for the first time, I tend to buy one, try the fit and go from there. I got it right the first time around on these, so I ordered another pair About two weeks after the first, and now last night ordered my third pair. I really like the fit, the feel, everything about them. I don’t give out five star reviews very often, but these get five stars from me!
customer_reviews.author: Doityourselfer

customer_reviews.title: May want to get two sizes larger. Large has 22" inseam
customer_reviews.text: Now I now what it feels like to wear tights. Based on my size, I needed something between medium and large, so I went with large to allow for shrinkage when I wash them, but even large seem too small and short to me. The have alot of stretch so I will keep them and hope they don't shrink much after a wash. Update: After trying these tights on, I measured them and as you can see in the pictures, the inseam is 22" with an overall length of 35". That's 10" too short for me, and keep in mind, these are "LARGE". Unexceptable!
customer_reviews.author: alko

customer_reviews.title: Holier Than Thou Wouldst Like
customer_reviews.text: These are always on the small side and they shrink too. Buy large unless you plan to shrink with them. I like these for their warmth and function, but I gave 3 stars because they ALWAYS wear out in the crotch. ALWAYS. I have used this brand for ten years, probably, so it is not just one bad batch. They ALWAYS get holes and get the holes too quickly. I do not abuse them. There is something about the material. It needs to be reinforced in the family jewels area.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Brody

customer_reviews.title: They don't make them like they used to!
customer_reviews.text: Duofold has been the go to brand for me for long johns for many years. Not any more! These pants have been worn for perhaps three weeks and there is a hole in the knee already! The lining started pilling and coming out as soon as I put them on. It didn't take long to go through the knee. I used to get a couple of years out of these and I don't even do the amount of physical work I used to do. VERY disappointed....:-(
customer_reviews.author: Deborah F. Hamel

customer_reviews.title: Order Information page inaccurate or misleading
customer_reviews.text: First I love Doufold products! When searching for these, the page came up as thermal pants, then size chart, = order size M. No where on the page does it say "tops" size chart for pants, not tops! I received the bottoms and they dont fit. Ok, check size chart on box and the size I ordered were for Tops. No where on order page did it say Tops! I am giving these to my son, he says he can fit in them. I needed L evidently from new chart info. I will continue using my torn doufolds until I can save up for new sized ones. Thanks for listening and please update your page! thank you. Joe
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent thermal pant, but sizes are WAY off!
customer_reviews.text: Read all the reviews and ordered a medium as recommended by so many other reviewers. That was a mistake! Ended up returning and ordering large. I'm 5'11", around 180 lbs. and normally wear 34x32 or 34x34 pants. If you are anywhere near my size and weight, ignore the charts and get the LARGE. Took one star off because I had to return and re-order. Size chart should indicate waist size 32-34 as large, not medium.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Downward Creepers
customer_reviews.text: Thought these were Great when they first came. Here it is, not quite a year later, & theyre driving me cRaZy. Nothing like the feeling of downward creepin' innerwear -fwiw- I'm exactly average weight / they don't seem to have lost elasticity. Living near Tahoe, I've got a Bunch of other brands, but I really wanted to like these. & Honestly can't explain it, but wish I could. They Are comfortable - until you move
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Best man’s friend for warmth
customer_reviews.text: Super delighted ! My thighs are always cold , I tried the fleece kind , but I get a rash from poly fabric , these are cotton and very comfortable . Can’t tell you enough how they are exactly what a wanted . I am 200 lbs 5.11 size 44 pants , took 2X , they fit perfect , not cold anymore !! To sleep I need to be warm, even the house is 72 degrees i am cold, I sleep with them to get a good night sleep I am purchasing more .
customer_reviews.author: S.B.G.

customer_reviews.title: NOT DOUBLE LAYER - thicker than the other mid weight ones - INFERIOR
customer_reviews.text: I had real double layer in the past. They should change their name to singofold. I don't know if the wrong ones were in the box - but I think it's just false advertising.
customer_reviews.author: UnCableGuy

customer_reviews.title: quality
customer_reviews.text: whats going on lately, the things I buy from amazon are junk. I had bought this item before on amazon and it was fine. The 2 pair I received looked as good as the one I had purchased before but when I washed them (I don't wear before I wash) they came out of the dryer looking very bad and the old one was washed with them and its still great. Now I'm stuck with them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Warm, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I had bought a pair of these before and simply wanted a second pair, since I often wear long underwear in the winter. They are warm but not too warm, and comfortable, soft against the skin, and fit me well. I've been quite satisfied with the first pair for several years (which are still going strong), and am happy to have a second.
customer_reviews.author: Careful Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Hubby's legs are comfy now
customer_reviews.text: Husband's been wearing these originals for years. This was a replacement purchase. He is about 5'9" and they are just barely long enough. Sized perfectly around the waist. Bought a small. He wears a 32 waist. Just mind how you care for them. I wash and hang dry so they don't shrink in the hot dryer (wool). He wears everyday to work where he kneels on a regular basis. We get several years out of them before the knees need attention. He has a variety of duofold bottom weights and chooses which to wear according to how cold it will be outside.
customer_reviews.author: Bren

customer_reviews.title: warm, comfortable, short lifespan
customer_reviews.text: The thermal pants are warm, soft against the skin and comfortable to wear. They do a great job at wicking away perspiration at moderate activity levels and keep me warm in 20 degree weather. After wearing them for 2 winter seasons, the inner layer has developed many small holes in the knee and crotch area. I had no problems with shrinking since I hand-wash them in lukewarm water, mild soap and air-dry to minimize the beating a garment can take in the dryer. I gave it a 3-star rating because of the shorter-than-expected lifespan.
customer_reviews.author: GZLZ

customer_reviews.title: Love these thermal long-johns
customer_reviews.text: Love these thermal long-johns. Very good for moderate activity in temps down to around 10o. Below that I switch to the heavyweight from the same brand. I like that the use a wool mix for the outer layer and a comfy cotton inner layer. They stand up well to repeated washings too but I like to let them air dry so they last even longer. Wisconsin winters mean I get to wear them a lot. I get about five years out of these before the elastic waistband fails. Been buying this brand for more than 30 years because it's a good product.
customer_reviews.author: libertywatch

customer_reviews.title: Best long johns by far
customer_reviews.text: Stop shopping & buy these. They are the best on the market. Unfortunately they aren't as good as their older models from about 15 years ago... had to buy new due to the elastic failing after 15 years. Super high quality & very warm. NOT itchy at all. Just buy them. I also compared prices everywhere I could find these & this is the best price.
customer_reviews.author: Urban CowboyTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased many Duofold thermals for the men in my family. The last ones I purchased did not hold up. They were purchased a year ago and were worn for a very short time. The area of the thighs is almost worn through. I never had a problem like this before. I will probably try one more time, because these thermals are very comfortable. But if the same thing happens again, I will have to look for another brand. I wonder if Duofold has several manufacturing plants. Perhaps that explains the difference in quality?
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Don't go without a pair of these
customer_reviews.text: Went to Fairbanks Alaska in early March when the days were in single digits and the nights were down to -35. I wore this as my only layer (under my jeans or Arctix snow pants) for extended periods outside both day and night (low to moderate activity). I was warm the entire time - even noticing some sweat after walking thru snow fields). Definitely did a good job for me- better than my surplus poly-pros!
customer_reviews.author: Joe DIY

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Duofold long underwear for several years. They are a bit short for me, they don't offer them in a tall. I try to never put them in the dryer and often I stretch them to make them longer. I hold the bottom with my toes and pull tup on the top. Basically they are a very good warm product that will last several years.
customer_reviews.author: steven algren

customer_reviews.title: The rise is loooong.
customer_reviews.text: I bpught these for my father. The pants fit ok. These pants are like other men's pants of this sort in that the crotch is ridiculously long. I've had to have the rise altered so that they fit him comfortably. My father has what he likes to call a "Buddha belly.." Even with his stomach being so round, the rise on these pants come up over his belly button to about his mid-chest. The legs fit perfectly, the rise is an ongoing issue that has afflicted many men's pants of this sort.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Best long underwear ever.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I had a set that I bought sometim in the early 1990's and I loved them so much that I quite literally wore them out. Seriously the previous pair finally looks like I was attached by a savage bobcat or something. So when the wife said "it's time" I bought the same brand and materials. They were probably servicable for 15 years before I replaced them. I wear them on sub-zero windy days with just jeans over them and I am fine. I can't recommend thes highly enough, and I've worn out a lot fo long underwear in my days. The caveat being buy by inseam. I bought the Large top, and the XL bottom.
customer_reviews.author: D. Cameron Calkins

customer_reviews.title: For skiing/snowboarding they are perfect. Forget all that garbage about needing "wicking" material
customer_reviews.text: For skiing/snowboarding they are perfect. Forget all that garbage about needing "wicking" material. You'll be wearing snow pants over these so no moisture will escape. Cotton is what you want to absorb any sweat. Those hi tech wicking materials just make the sweat run down your leg. Same goes for the shirts. Nothing more uncomfortable than feeling sweat drip down your body. Stick with cotton! Those wicking materials are only good when they are exposed to the air.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Bonadonna

customer_reviews.title: good product - wish it was still made in Hometown, PA
customer_reviews.text: After a zillion years I needed a new pair of long johns. The ones I had were purchased at the Duofold outlet in Hometown, Pennsylvania where Duofold was manufactured for years. Like so many products, it was shipped overseas for manufacture. Just wish it was still made in Hometown - and that name is no joke. It's right between Tamaqua and Macadoo
customer_reviews.author: James L Margrave Jr

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace an older pair of duofold long Johns that had 40 % wool in them ,and these did better then the older pair ALL DAY out in the wind and cold, it was about 10 degrees without the wind..I WILL BUT THESE AGAIN..as far as shrinking wash in warm water and dry on low!!!
customer_reviews.author: woof

customer_reviews.title: Elasticity of the waistband lost after two years.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of Duofold Men's Mid Weight Wicking Thermal Pant, Black, Medium on November 9, 2015. I was happy and bought another pair on January 5, 2016. Within the last month, I threw out both pairs. The waist elastic in both has lost all elasticity. The rode down to my thighs within minutes of putting them on under loose pants.
customer_reviews.author: Harry B. Laufman

customer_reviews.title: Longer than expected
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the large pants and they are longer than I expected, I normally wear 29 length inseam or sometimes a 30" if 29's are not available. I didn't measure these but I would say they were longer than 30. They were also a little loose in the top area. I washed and dried them hot, which you are not supposed to do, but they now fit perfect. Hopefully they won't shrink again but I'll use gentle cycle with low temps from now on. We had our first below 30 degree morning last week and they felt great.
customer_reviews.author: HB

customer_reviews.title: Review
customer_reviews.text: They fit as advertised. However, they are not what I would say is double layered nor are they as warm as I hoped for. If they are mid weight I sure would not want light weight. I suspect the only way to get thermal underwear is to go to a store and look try[ them on.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Jerry Stettheimer

customer_reviews.title: International Falls w
customer_reviews.text: My husband needed some new long underwear pants and I thought these looked like they'd work for our winters. My husband says they're great for outside, but when he comes in they need to come off. That's a change from his others that were okay if he was working, chilly in the deer stand, and not too warm for in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Krisgo

customer_reviews.title: it can get pretty cold. These are just such great quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these last year as a Christmas present, and just re purchased gir this year too. My fiancée wears thermal long johns all winter owning a transmission shop, it can get pretty cold. These are just such great quality! They are thick and so warm but the biggest PLUS is that they are BABY SOFT. Very very very comfortable. Like stepping into your favorite blanket for legs Highly recommend. ( they wash and wear well too. Great quality) last years pairs still in excellent condition! Despite heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: SWIM N💦W w/ EiLEEN!

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I did not give 5 stars is because the legs could be longer (Size Large). The inseam is about 26", they do stretch however not to 32" which is my inseam size; and I am an average size for a large. A tall large would be 34" inseam, and these would be extremely short for a person with longer than average legs!
customer_reviews.author: Alain V.

customer_reviews.title: Did not last long.
customer_reviews.text: Received top & Bottoms Nov. 2020 & the first time I washed the top it came apart at the shoulders. I sent them back and they shipped me a new one. Now the bottoms are coming apart on the inside. I would expect them to last a bit longer then 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: cw

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but as others have stated there's a lot material ...
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable but as others have stated there's a lot material in the crotch, this creates some bulk under my jeans. The material feels good on the legs. They're fitted on the legs but they stretch so they don't feel super tight. I've been wearing a polyester compression type baselayer and these are more comfortable. Not sure how warm they'll be in comparison seeing it's Spring...kind of. I wear a 32 waist and 34 inseam. The medium fits fine.
customer_reviews.author: T. Connolly

customer_reviews.title: Warm and good fit.
customer_reviews.text: Dual layer makes it extremely warm. Stretch without too much non-cotton or polyester material. The crotch is *slightly* low, but these are intended to wear with underwear underneath it would seem, so that isn't an issue. Worth 30 or so and was on sale.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend going up a size if you don't want the ...
customer_reviews.text: bought this for husband who never wore anything underneath pants even under 32 degrees. He likes this. We bought a size larger than the description. I would recommend going up a size if you don't want the pants to be too snug. Men usually don't like their pants too tight,,, right?
customer_reviews.author: S.

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase.
customer_reviews.text: *UPDATE* These pants are STILL freaking awesome and I'll be buying more soon -— Yup. I like them. I work outdoors and usually just doubled up on regular thermal pants when it got below freezing. These are 10 times softer and more comfortable and don't require me to double up while still keeping me warm. The crotch area is larger than normal thermals and, no, they aren't as long as normal pants, but as an undergarment there is plenty of room and they are perfect for layering socks over the ankle cuffs. Highly recommended and, for $20, you can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: I you want to stay warm, these are the ticket.
customer_reviews.text: I have tried myriad brands, styles, and textile combinations of thermal underwear, and none even come close to these. They are comfortable, breathable and WARM. They are comfortable even if the ambient temperature gets too warm. Having the two layers, cotton inside and the Merino wool blend outside is truly amazing. They wash and dry well, though the care instructions are semi-cryptic with international symbols and various languages. Turn them inside out to wash, warm water, dry on low heat, do not use chlorine bleach. Shrinkage from washing is minimal. Turning inside out is pretty important, it seems to prevent pilling and felting. I will never waste my money on any other type again
customer_reviews.author: SAH

customer_reviews.title: but I'm sure he was glad to have them to wear under his
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband for our trip to Alaska. temps were -20 to -1 while there. He said they were nicer than his walmart pair, but didn;t seem particularly warm. in negative degrees, I'm not sure what would be considered warm, but I'm sure he was glad to have them to wear under his pants/snowpants
customer_reviews.author: Bunny

customer_reviews.title: Super Shrinkable
customer_reviews.text: Washed cold and hung to dry and it shrank to half its size. Won't fit me now! Now I am out the money I paid.... Buyer beware!!
customer_reviews.author: Sid's Kid

customer_reviews.title: Shrink too much
customer_reviews.text: I bought a green pair and I liked it so I bought another blue pair. But the quality is not consistent. The blue pair shrunk so much from the first time I wash them. I use the same washer and dryer. The green pair hold up well. But the blue one shrunk from L to kids size after 3 times. I can’t wear them anymore.
customer_reviews.author: bloodypixy

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this product.
customer_reviews.text: Keep me warm but second time I wore them I grasped the material mid thigh to pull them up an ripped a hole in them. Unbelievable. Will never buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and warm but inconsistent quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought one size up. After washing and drying (with dryer), it shrank a little and turned thicker, as desired. Warm. Will buy more. Update: Bought one Duofold double-layer last year and gave 5 stars. That one is so good that I decided to buy 2 more this year. The items were delivered quickly and looked very good. However the first wash reduced their lengths By maybe 10-12 inches because they are about 10” far away from ankles. They are still soft and warm but useless to me. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: melon

customer_reviews.title: GREAT fit, GREAT warmth PERFECT for base layer for skiers!!
customer_reviews.text: These Double Layer Thermal underwear were for my husband. Duofold is a preferred brand by him and we were delighted to see these offered on Amazon! We knew the size to order because he has owned these before so though he is usually a large, we knew to order a medium instead. The fit was as expected because we knew what to expect. Does that make sense?! Very pleased that these are comfortable, warm and wash up well! Follow washing instructions and these should last a long time. As did my husband's previous pair! Very satisfied with this purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: B. J. Theis

customer_reviews.title: Fits great works great
customer_reviews.text: Bought these specifically for a camping trip I was taking in Payson, AZ in December. If you aren't familiar with AZ... north of the Phoenix Metropolitan area it gets very cold and snowy. It's the mountains. In any case, I needed these to work well with a pair of blue jeans as my outer layer in 15 degree lows at night. Obviously if all I had used were these and jeans I would have froze. But our fire and my nice sleeping bag made it a great trip. Moral of this review... these are very good and will keep you comfortable in cold temperatures as long as you aren't expecting them to be the MAJOR source of your warmth.
customer_reviews.author: SunDevil03

customer_reviews.title: Thought they were the best pair we'd ever purchased. Fast forward about three weeks, and they have disintegrated.
customer_reviews.text: My husband works in an environment where he needs thermal pants every day in the winter. When these first came, he loved them. He said they were so warm, and so light at the same time. He thought they were the best pair we'd ever purchased, and he wanted to buy a few more pairs. Fast forward about three weeks, and they have disintegrated. Good thing we hadn't bought any extra pairs yet. If these things lasted even 6 months, it would have been a 5 star review from us.
customer_reviews.author: countrygalut

customer_reviews.title: Not good for tall people
customer_reviews.text: There are a couple of things wrong with these.. They stretch out throughout the day, they ride up, and they are so short! They were short to begin with on my husband who is 6’2. To make it even worse they shrunk so bad they now go up to his knees which makes them completely ineffective for warmth.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: NOT for human males
customer_reviews.text: This is Earth. We are humans. These were made for aliens that urinate from their right hip. Unusable without removing belt and pants. Are you freaking kidding me? Utter garbage.
customer_reviews.author: lonewolfmtn

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased these before. Great for camping or for wearing on cold nights when I don't want to use heat. The elastic loses stretch over the years but that is to be expected. For the price, these are great. They are comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: So Cal hiker

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, comfy, and not short.
customer_reviews.text: My husband says that it’s the best underpants that he ever used. Great fit and keeps him warm, not too short and stitching doesn’t come apart.
customer_reviews.author: Anutkini Glazki

customer_reviews.title: They're super warm and ultra comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 38 pant size and am 5'7" tall. Ordered the Large and they fit perfectly. They're super warm and ultra comfortable. I do think the crotch area sits a little lower than normal but it's nothing I'd dock any stars for.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Braunstein

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: Had been looking for a pair that weren't that awful waffle pattern for a long time. These are warm and comfortable. Wear them hunting, ice fishing, working outside in the winter months. I live in Minnesota so I know a decent pair of long underwear when I come across them.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Greene

customer_reviews.title: Very soft, warm, comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I don't think there's a better product for the price. I've got merino thermals too, they're great. But man, when I see what's available for comparable prices, it's all polyester/acrylic/and some minor percentage of cotton and/or merino. Fit is fine, cool color too (army green).
customer_reviews.author: El Ropadope

customer_reviews.title: Way too small
customer_reviews.text: I think they are mislabeled. Box said men's large. Pants said large. But these were a full 12 inches shorter than all the other duofold long johns size men's large that I have. Maybe a youth size? Dunno. Returned for credit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: fits well. soft. winter protective.
customer_reviews.text: GOod product. liked it. fits well. protects from winter well. double-layered as advertised. inner cotton makes it feel smooth. maintained its shape after a couple of washes.
customer_reviews.author: bAnsIonCal

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: These are great, glad I got them. They are not necessarily for skiing but i need something thicker that would keep me warm in the canadian rockies during February. They sure helped out alot, and I am glad I got them. I wore a silk base layer under them, and ski pants on top, It was -26 F .
customer_reviews.author: Ranger

customer_reviews.title: Not bulky, warm and soft
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to keep in a disaster go bag. It's soft, fitted without being tight. My husband is 5' 5", wears 36 waist with 30 inseem in pants. I'd recommend it and buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't keep you as warm as you would like it to
customer_reviews.text: I only use this to sleep because it doesn't really help with the cold outside. And don't try to you wear it under your pants, it rolls up when you're putting them on, leaving your ankles exposed to the cold. Next time, I'll buy something that sticks close to the body and isn't made of cotton. The fabric is thin and the construction is loose.
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: It's just what I've been looking for
customer_reviews.text: These are warm and soft. These make my regular jeans just as warm as my fleece lined jeans (without long underwear). Also, these have a fly unlike many thermal pants and they are made for a grown man with a higher waist band.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great weight, warmth under jeans.
customer_reviews.text: The double layer with merino wool is still light enough to fit easily under jeans on cold winter days outside. Soft and warm, breathable. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: K. Christensen

customer_reviews.title: These fit snug to the body
customer_reviews.text: These are true to size. They fit snug to the body which is something to get accustomed to for older men. The waist band is comfortable to wear.
customer_reviews.author: djnorthwoods

customer_reviews.title: Great price, comfortable and warm. But:
customer_reviews.text: I really like this, especially for the price. I am a tall and skinny get and tend to get cold in our long Utah Winters. The reason for the 3 stars is after only 2 or 3 months I am starting to wear a hole on the backside.
customer_reviews.author: DerekBird

customer_reviews.title: WARM WARM WARM
customer_reviews.text: Spent 3 nights in sub 20-25 degree weather while camping at Yosemite. Granted I had a really nice sleeping bag, this thermal kept me warm throughout the trip. During the day, it was 35-40 degrees so not nearly as cold, and I wore this under my jeans, and that was more than enough to keep me warm.
customer_reviews.author: Julian Nam

customer_reviews.title: This is a quality item
customer_reviews.text: I have used this brand for decades. My old ones are losing their elastic, and I have put on weight so I wanted a new pair. Now I will buy a couple more so I can always have a clean pair.
customer_reviews.author: Jo in Maine

customer_reviews.title: Long Johns double layer Wool Cotton Thermal
customer_reviews.text: Bought these 1 size up to have littlie more room and they fit as expected. Like the fact the material is more wool & cotton than polyester.
customer_reviews.author: Stoneagesummer

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and warm...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for our sons trip to the snow. He said they were awesome. Very comfortable and did an excellent job of keeping him warm.
customer_reviews.author: G. Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Shrinks & proportions off.
customer_reviews.text: Soft and warm, one wash and the legs are a lot shorter, but the pelvic area is super long. I'd expect that from a 10$ pair but not 20$. I still wear them because they're warm but they definitely fit weird now.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.White

customer_reviews.title: Warm and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic. The most comfortable of all the long underwear I own because it keeps me warm without being hot. The cotton/wool blend feels much nicer than my synthetic pairs and so far has kept me happy at 8 degrees F. with a pair of heavy sweats over them. They are not thin, but not bunchy or bulky, either. I would make an allowance for the thickness underneath jeans or casual pants.
customer_reviews.author: FredBarney

customer_reviews.title: Nice and warm
customer_reviews.text: My husband works outside frequently, and these keep him warm. He's had several different brands, and these are the ones he requested I buy more of when he needed to replace some older long johns this winter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it
customer_reviews.text: Fit great and super comfortable that I forget I have them on sometimes. Double layered keep me from having to wear 2 pairs on cold mornings.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and light weight.
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t used them yet, but did try them on. Great fit and I’m 6’ 4”. They seem a bit light weight but new fabrics are amazing so I’ll find out soon. I’ll be using them when I’m in my float tube in the sierras. Nice cold water. Should be a good test.
customer_reviews.author: R. Roark

customer_reviews.title: Great price, really soft and warm, perfect fit.
customer_reviews.text: They fit great! I usually wear 32-33" waist x 32" legs and was afraid this was going to be too tight or short from the reviews I had read, but on the contrary it fits perfect. I just took my precautions and I am washing it in cool water only and not using a dryer but rather dry it flat. Fabric is really soft both outside and inside and is just thick enough that it doesn't make you feel you are wearing layers at all but still keeps me warm. I recommend it 100%.
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: Buy DuoFold. That is all.
customer_reviews.text: I have, until I received DuoFold thermal underwear a few years ago for Christmas, always wore the "waffle weave" stuff. If you're currently wearing waffle weave, bite the bullet, spend the extra money and buy DuoFold. You'll never go back, trust me. Waffle weave always fit me sloppily, and if you get the right size, DuoFold is like a second warm, THERMAL skin. I could not give this product a higher rating. If it were a 10 star system, it would be 10 star thermal underwear. Buy these products. Period.
customer_reviews.author: Steverino1984

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality control. Quite a few seams were sewn incorrectly, separated, or had actual holes. Sadly this is becoming typical of online purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Zentastic

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable fit that keeps me warm
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had the best of luck with long johns, most were too tight or too lose. However, these Duofold's are the most comfortable pair I have ever worn and worked well to keep me warm when I was wearing jeans in 30 degree cold weather.. I bought an L and it fits perfectly at the waist and the inner layer doesn't irritate my legs.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel L. Hood

customer_reviews.title: Super Fit and Warmth
customer_reviews.text: Great fit. Comfortable in layering. Perfect for subzero temps in northwesten PA.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer on the river four

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and warm.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for cold weather, 20 to 40 degree days. Lightweight and does the job. Great for out door sports like skiing too.
customer_reviews.author: G. Simon

customer_reviews.title: Warm
customer_reviews.text: 3 years in.... the elastic is finally giving up. Other than that there isn’t a need to replace them. I work 12s overnight and these see use from mid October until mid April. Very durable other than the elastic finally giving up. Will retire them this year and replace next season.
customer_reviews.author: Earl Farina

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, very warm
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'1 ~170lbs and these fit perfectly, my legs feel warm and comfortable walking around in 20F weather.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: A best buy. You will not go wrong staying warm.
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the most affordable warmth on the market. The combination of Merino wool and cotton is the difference. The vendor ships very quickly. Will continue to purchase from them.
customer_reviews.author: Jvpdriven

customer_reviews.title: Different than original style
customer_reviews.text: Didn't realize that these are compression long johns, wanted the original style. But these do a good job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fit Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'9, weight 175 and have a 31 inch waist. I bought a medium and they fit perfectly under my jeans.
customer_reviews.author: Ray N

customer_reviews.title: Extremely comfortable base layer
customer_reviews.text: Extremely comfortable base layer. I work in the oil industry and need natural fiber long underwear for winter work. This is far superior to the cotton waffle pattern stuff I have been stuck using for years. Performs much more like a high quality synthetic base layer.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, even for outdoor electrical installer - year round!!
customer_reviews.text: We've purchased these 3 times now for hubby. He works outdoors year round and needs to depend on quality, comfort and fit. The fit is spot on; the fabric launders well and is quite durable. This time we opted for the heavier weight and he loves them. Will def buy again and again.
customer_reviews.author: kerry

customer_reviews.title: Quality appears to be good, fit OK
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6 feet tall with 33-inch inseam and 31-inch waist. I weigh 168lbs. I bought a medium. They fit OK but the legs are a bit short and the crotch is a bit low.
customer_reviews.author: Bill-bob

customer_reviews.title: Fit great and last for years
customer_reviews.text: I bought a two pairs of these several years ago and they are still going strong despite very heavy use. Elastic had stayed tight and no signs of wear in the material. When most clothing is cheap and lasts only a single season it's nice to buy something that exceeds expectations. I recently bought two more pairs and would highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Warm and cozy
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my dad as a Christmas present and he loves! He has been wearing all winter in cold snowy Ohio and said they are comfortable and keep him warm.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Warm base layer
customer_reviews.text: A nice base layer, warm and comfortable. Only issue was the shrinkage when washed and dried per instructions. They did stretch to fit after laundering but was amazed at the amount of shrinkage. Probably best to line dry these...
customer_reviews.author: Karen R Risdon

customer_reviews.title: warm and cozy
customer_reviews.text: great thermal, WAY more comfortable than standard waffle poly/cottons. wish it had more wool in the blend on the outer layer, but no major complaints. i bought 5 pairs its all i wear in the winter now
customer_reviews.author: discretionaryconsumer

customer_reviews.title: Warm but they run small
customer_reviews.text: They are definitely warm but they run small, and don’t put them in the dryer cause they’ll shrink a ton. I have a 35” waist and had to get the XL pair I threw a couple pairs in the dryer on delicate and they shank to the point that I couldn’t wear them.
customer_reviews.author: Tony F

customer_reviews.title: Passed the wind chill test.
customer_reviews.text: Thermals fit very nice and comfortable. Being 5'11, the thermals rise above my belt line quite significantly. They are warm, they passed the 7 degree wind chill test with flying colors.
customer_reviews.author: Geo51

customer_reviews.title: Real Duofolds!
customer_reviews.text: Original duofolds were both cotton and wool. Some now are poly which is nice sometimes and I own some of them. These are like the originals and are my favorite. Make sure the construction materials are listed so you aren't disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: jbama

product_meta.title: Duofold Men's Midweight Double-Layer Thermal Pant
product_meta.description: Duofold originals created the base layer category with the first bi-ply thermals soft cotton against the skin and paired with the natural warmth of merino wool for superior thermal insulation, perfect for a wide range of low-impact activities
feature_bullets: Inside Layer: 100% Cotton; Outer Layer: 65% Cotton, 25% Merino Wool, 10% Nylon
Two-layer thermal for warmth in cold weather
